item.title: Git repository
item.description:
https://github.com/krizoek/Scripture

Some of you might have noticed that the cvs repository on sourceforge hasn't been updated for quite some time.
I found it a little efforting having to update small modifications all the time and to add recursivly with cvs.

Now I've found git a little more efficient, and I also like the idea of using another project hosting site in case this one falls down.
Github have a very good application for windows which im using mostly.

I will try to update changes and write some notes sometimes, and if you make changes or add features that you wish to participate with; github will be the place that we will be using for now.
 

By uid[1]

item.title: Why is this project free?
item.description:
MAT 21:12 [CLEANSING OF THE TEMPLE] And Jesus went into the temple of God, and cast out all them that sold and bought in the temple, and overthrew the tables of the moneychangers, and the seats of them that sold doves
13 And said unto them, It is written, My house shall be called the house of prayer; but ye have made it a den of thieves.

MAT 10:7 And as ye go, preach, saying, The kingdom of heaven is at hand.
8 Heal the sick, cleanse the lepers, raise the dead, cast out devils: freely ye have received, freely give.
9 Provide neither gold, nor silver, nor brass in your purses
10 Nor scrip for [your] journey, neither two coats, neither shoes, nor yet staves: for the workman is worthy of his meat.

Whats my food and my work ?.

I do work with a worldly job as faith demands.

1CO 4:12 And labour, working with our own hands: being reviled, we bless; being persecuted, we suffer it:
EPH 4:28 Let him that stole steal no more: but rather let him labour, working with [his] hands the thing which is good, that he may have to give to him that needeth.

In faith, what i eat is this.

JHN 4:32 But he said unto them, I have meat to eat that ye know not of.
33 Therefore said the disciples one to another, Hath any man brought him [ought] to eat?
34 Jesus saith unto them, My meat is to do the will of him that sent me, and to finish his work.
35 Say not ye, There are yet four months, and [then] cometh harvest? behold, I say unto you, Lift up your eyes, and look on the fields; for they are white already to harvest.

My work is this:

JHN 4:34 Jesus saith unto them, My meat is to do the will of him that sent me, and to finish his work

How then could i in faith demand money of people for the word they seek. I would rather see that everyone came together into building a tool that was free, and where we all gathered our riches in the heavens rather than in this world; where everything fades away.

What then about adverticement?

Good question. Will i allow carnal parties to promote their projects here in a blitzing manner?. Will they not disturb our study.
Do we not hear babbling of this sort everywhere, why then would we want it here.

Am I to ask for money?, What then would i profit in the heavens.

Why would I take from the worker, steal like the worldy governments of this world.

How then were I in a serving spirit if I forced other to serve me?

Why would I ask that you pay out your belongings, you could in your right mind choose to use your own efforts toward God yourself.
We all know there is poor everywhere, and that there is billions of people chosing to put time in asking for money for such a effort.

I must add, i'm sick and tired of hearing about money babble when i seek the truth.

I will not allow this place to turn into a "den of thieves." As Jesus put it; in his spirit, may we prevail.

By uid[1]

item.title: Mind and Site-Map of Project
item.description:
This is a start at mapping the entire project.

I will start to map even developer functions, and having ideas in there as well.

http://BibleWay.us/Mindmap

You may download the map here

What editor i prefer for mindmaps is freeplane with all its addons; Download it here

By uid[1]

item.title: How long will this site be online?
item.description:
The website is hosted on sourceforge.com ; which is a organization who aims at supporting opensource projects like this. They make money through ads and donation.
They do respect "old projects"; so even the dead ones stand. And by this I expect this site to stand for as long as there exist computers, opensource developers and also internet connection to USA.
But beside this i'll continue in the future to make backup and restore features so no information can be lost.

This site have 3 domains for now, bibleway.us is a payable domain, and it might go down when i do. But the free domains scripture.sf.net and bibel.sf.net will continue.
This project "scripture" is a opensource; which means that it's code is available to the other. And as developments turn, I will release future releases.

I don't prioritize this as long as noone shows any interest in joining the development; so i continue alone as always.

Then if it was a time this site died; someone else would have the source and be able to host it.

By uid[1]

item.title: Creating Bible Maps Part 1
item.description:
Goto Dialer
→Topic
→(Click on any map)
→Choose New Map
→Choose a "title" and click Go

Go back to Topic dialer and choose your map

Click on New Entry
→Choose a "Menu item" subject. For example "GEN" Short for genesis.
→Choose a title. For example "Both man and woman possess the seed of life"
→Choose a context, For example ";GEN 3:15"
→If you for example wish to enter a date of "scientific discovery"; enter the year: 1700
→Now choose the type "Context and verses are links". For the context ";Gen 3:15" to be linked.
→Hit Go to save.

Then your done.

This is one of many possible ways of generating maps.
You may experiment using the Testmap if you want.

By uid[1]

item.title: How to search between verses
item.description:

On the bottom of results-page hit the link for searching between verses.

item.title: Something to share? Then contribute
item.description:
This project/site sends a request to you who is out there.

Join this community.
Share your tallents as it might be given with the Lord.

This project is free; and welcome contributers. We don't require money; but rather we would do better with you. If you are gifted by God.
This site will grow, new features will come. You don't need to be a developer in order to contribute.

This could be your project too!
Get content. Share it. Write it. Communicate.

By uid[1]

item.title: Scripture - Opensource Crossplatform Biblestudy
item.description:
No more need for countless applications for mobile phones, ebooks, computers and other devices.
Save money and use your time with whats given freely for most modern apparatus.


Screenguide


With the help of the Open Source PHP project "Scripture".
I may now study the "Textus Receptus"-Bible having language-notes from both Byziantine and Nestle. Link
It also allows me to write notes, either by "quicknotes" or verse-specific.
The same regards for crossreferences.I may not only lookup crossreferences, but also write my own.

"Scripture" Allows me to have as many bookmarks, favorites, and notes i want for verses.
And if i feel like it; I"m a single click away from having backup of my notes.
The project also have a multi categorical forum, blog, article, podcasts and much more..

A very special feature is whats called "Superdial". It allows me to map the bible in ways as never before.
Take a look for yourself and see: Link

Headlines throughout the bible may also be accessed easily by this Headline dial: Link

And when I"m in trouble I could always go to the Chat where they also allow easy access to bible verses.
The site offers Strongs concordances for many various translation; ranges from Greek, German, To English versions.

Site is unique from most modern large bible application by that It"s main focus is the majority texts(Also called byziantine text-type).
Modern application focuses on popular bible translations that believe they are the "majority text"; this is because instead of including the differences in their versions. They remove it all by also using other texts wich is mostly questionable. Textus receptus was based on the byziantine texts, but only 30 available at that time for the translator; but atleast it didn"t remove hundreds, and changed thousands of verses to agree with questionable findings!.
And this makes it also more reliable by standing with more livable witnesses.
Site even allows multi-verses: Link

No need to have two mobiles, now i can do multi/interlinear bible study with this application on a single phone for free!.
Forget bibleworks and youversion, and join this free crossplatform project instead!.


Keyfeatures:

PHP. Mobile. Cross References, Search, Strongs, Dictionary
Interlinear/multi[parallel reader,list,lookup]
Notes, Commentaries, Bookmarks, Chat,
Headlines Importers(bibleworks), Exporters, History,
Highlights Forum/Podcast., KJV.., Multiverses,..



  • Strongs concordance.

  • Parallel-read / interlinear scripture study.

  • Favorite verses and bookmarks, note and quicknote functions

  • Search and lookup history

  • Multi-categorical Forum, blogg, articles, podcast, etc....

  • Crossreferences and user-crossreference ability

  • Multiverse lookup example: .mat 5:1-11 .mat 28:20 .1jo 5:1-4

  • Regex Search example: r: ^love

  • Multi keyword search example: Blessed are -Love

  • Passage lookup example: mat 22:36 or: 1co 13

  • Book specific search example: Blessed are mat()

  • Install, Update and Backup/restore systems.

  • Ability to use all bibles from bibleworks (see readme)

  • IRC chat(online) and parsing script(mIRC)

  • Multiple modes for strongs display (listboxes, tooltip, and link)

  • Alternative editor features(CKeditor and TinyMCE) w/upload capabilities

  • Bible Dial, and new "Superdial/Map" function.


(Some images might be outdated)



List of bibles for this project






By uid[1]

item.title: Understanding Byziantine and Nestle Language Notes
item.description:
http://scripture.sourceforge.net/index.php?s=&b=9&bk=MAT&c=1 
NOUNS, ADJECTIVES, AND MINOR PARTS OF SPEECH 

UNDECLINED FORMS:

       ADV    =   ADVerb or adverb and particle combined
       CONJ   =   CONJunction or conjunctive particle
       COND =   CONDitional particle or conjunction
       PRT      =   PaRTicle, disjunctive particle
       PREP    =   PREPosition
       INJ        =   INterJection
       ARAM =   ARAMaic transliterated word (indeclinable)
       HEB      =   HEBrew transliterated word (indeclinable)
       N-PRI   =   Indeclinable PRoper Noun
       A-NUI  =   Indeclinable NUmeral (Adjective)
       N-LI     =   Indeclinable Letter (Noun)
       N-OI     =   Indeclinable Noun of Other type

DECLINED FORMS:
 All follow the order: prefix-case-number-gender-(suffix)
Prefixes:
       N-    =   Noun
       A-    =   Adjective
       R-     =   Relative pronoun
       C-     =   reCiprocal pronoun
       D-    =   Demonstrative pronoun
       T-     =   definite arTicle
       K-    =   correlative pronoun
       I-      =   Interrogative pronoun
       X-     =   indefinite pronoun
       Q-    =   correlative or interrogative pronoun
       F-     =   reFlexive pronoun (person 1:2,3 added)
       S-     =   poSsessive pronoun (person 1:2,3 added)
       P-     =   Personal pronoun (person 1:2,3 added)
 
(Note: 1st and 2nd personal pronouns have no gender)
Cases:
       -N    =   Nominative (5-case system)
       -V    =   Vocative
       -G    =   Genitive
       -D    =   Dative
       -A    =   Accusative
Number:            Gender:
S = Singular       M   =   Masculine
P = Plural           F     =   Feminine
                        N    =   Neuter

Suffixes:
       -S      =   Superlative (used primarily with adjectives and some adverbs)
       -C      =   Comparative (used primarily with adjectives and some adverbs)
       -ABB   =  ABBreviated  form  (used  only  with  certain  numbers  in  Revelation  as
                    printed in some early editions)
       -I    =   Interrogative
       -N   =   Negative (used with some particles, adverbs, adjectives, and conjunctions)
       -K   =   Kai  Kai  Kai  Kai  (CONJ)  merged  by  crasis  with  forms  of  the  demonstrative  pronoun
                  ekeino=        ekeino=        ekeino=        ekeino=  or  the  first  person  personal  pronoun  egw  egw egw  egw;  also,  the  neuter
                  definite  article  to   to   to   to  merged  by  crasis  with  a  second  word.  Declension
                  follows that of the second word.
       -ATT =  ATTic Greek form
PARSED VERB FORMS:
All Greek verbs are listed in one of three various forms (where V = “Verb”):
 1) V-tense-voice-mood
 2) V-tense-voice-mood-person-number
 3) V-tense-voice-mood-case-number-gender


The abbreviations that pertain to each of these categories are the following:


Tense:
   P =   Present
   I  =   Imperfect
   F  =   Future  Second Future        =   2F
   A  =   Aorist  Second Aorist         =   2A
   R  =   peRfect  Second peRfect       =   2R
   L  =   pLuperfect  Second pLuperfect      =  2L
Voice:
   A =   Active
   M =   Middle
   P =   Passive
   E =   Either middle or passive
   D =   middle Deponent
   O  =   passive depOnent
   N  =   middle or passive depoNent
Mood:
   I =   Indicative
   S =   Subjunctive
   O =   Optative
   M =   iMperative
   N =   iNfinitive
   P =   Participle


 Extra:  -ATT      =   Attic Greek form
 Person: 1, 2, 3  =   First, Second, Third person
 Number: S, P     =   Singular, Plural
 Gender: M, F, N  =   Masculine, Feminine, Neuter


 Case:
   N         =   Nominative  (5-case system; no Vocative in verbal forms)
   G         =   Genitive
   D         =   Dative
   A         =   Accusative


More will be added here in the future

By uid[1]

item.title: Usage Examples
item.description:
Regex Search http://scripture.sf.net/?s=r%3A^love+ROM%281%29&b=1 example: r: ^love
Multi keyword search http://scripture.sf.net/?s=blessed+are+-Love+MAT%2811%29&b=1 example: Blessed are -Love
Passage lookup http://scripture.sf.net/?s=mat+28%3A20&b=1 example: mat 22:36 or: 1co 13
Book specific search example: Blessed are mat()

Regular expression information:

. match any character
? match zero or one
* match zero or more
+ match one or more
{n} match n times
{m,n} match m through n times
{n,} match n or more times
^ beginning of line
$ end of line
[[:<:]] match beginning of words
[[:>:]] match ending of words
[:class:] match a character class
i.e., [:alpha:] for letters
[:space:] for whitespace
[:punct:] for punctuation
[:upper:] for upper case letters
[abc] match one of enclosed chars
[^xyz] match any char not enclosed
| separates alternatives

MySQL interprets a backslash () character as an escape character. To use a backslash in a regular expression, you must escape it with another backslash ().

By uid[1]

item.title: Development performance tips
item.description:
These are also used as guideline for the development of this project: PHP tips
By using as little as possible function declarations, and class declarations, the performance results seems great.
Another thing is that i think It‘s best to have as little as possible comments as well (only small for directions and pointers). Reducing this will also reduce memory significantly.
for my.cnf or my.ini (mysql); i have the current setup. (would gladly be open for improvements and suggestions here):
key_buffer = 256M
max_allowed_packet = 16M
thread_stack = 192K
thread_cache_size = 8
table_cache = 6100
query_cache_limit = 32M
query_cache_size = 178M
max_heap_table_size = 64M
table_definition_cache = 512
table_open_cache = 5000
tmp_table_size = 64M
key_buffer = 16M
Performance data, is this for this page: in 2ms Mem: 118kB bData: 0kB/s PHP: 51MB/s 1kB. Normally things seems to be around 2-3ms when browsing KJaV(when there is sufficient usagetraffic).
The memory usage far undergo the usage for example of a drupal CMS system.

By uid[1]
